title: Bride rushed to hospital on wedding day after driver crashes into brick wall

A bride was rushed to hospital on her big day after her driver lost control of his car, driving straight into a wall.

Video footage shows the unnamed bride being escorted into the front passenger seat of a Ford Escort Cosworth RS rally type car.

A bridesmaid helps her squeeze her huge white gown into the vehicle.

Eventually, a wedding party member closes the car door and the bride makes a happy face for the camera before the vehicle starts driving off.

(Image: News Dog Media)

As the rally car heads off, a wedding party member encourages the driver to "Get em there lad! Plug it!".

The bride cheerfully waves goodbye to the camera as the driver speeds off and spins around a grass verge in racing rally car style.

The acceleration however causes the driver to completely lose control of the rally car and the vehicle forcefully crashes straight into a lamppost by a brick wall.

(Image: News Dog Media)

The incident took place on Saturday June 29 in Croft-on-Tees, Darlington in County Durham.

The clip cuts to an end as the wedding party is heard gasping in complete disbelief as the car smashes straight into the brick wall with huge force.

A spokesperson for North Yorkshire Police said: "Police received reports that a car left the road near Croft Spa hotel, Croft-on-Tees, at around 6.30pm on June 29.

"One woman who was a passenger in the vehicle was taken to hospital with injuries."

It is unclear how the driver was related to her or if the bride was on her way to the wedding service or the reception.

It is unknown who filmed the clip however the footage has been circulating on social media since last week.
description: WARNING - DISTRESSING CONTENT: Shocking footage shows the moment the driver loses control of his Ford Escort Cosworth while spinning around a verge in Darlington, County Durham.
